H0.text: who ran against abraham lincoln for president in 1860. John C. Breckinridge

H1.text: who ran against abraham lincoln for president in 1860. John Bell

H2.text: who ran against abraham lincoln for president in 1860. William L. Yancey

H3.text: who ran against abraham lincoln for president in 1860. Stephen A. Douglas

A4.text: Delegates from the Southern slave states elected incumbent Vice President John C. Breckinridge as their candidate.

A5.text: A group of former Whigs and Know Nothings formed the Constitutional Union Party and nominated John Bell of Tennessee.

A6.text: The Northern faction of the Democratic Party nominated Stephen A. Douglas as their presidential candidate.

A7.text: John Bell was the candidate of the Constitutional Union Party.
